article.headline: Chattanooga 75, Western Carolina 72
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. (AP) -- Keddric Mays scored a team-high 16 points and hit five 3-pointers to lead Chattanooga to a 75-72 win over Western Carolina on Monday. The Mocs were 6-for-8 from behind the 3-point-line in the second half of a game that saw 10 lead changes. Nicchaeus Doaks added 15 points and nine rebounds, and Casey Long scored 12 points and had five assists for Chattanooga (12-15, 5-10 Southern Conference). Jake Robinson led the Catamounts (10-15, 7-7) with 24 points, while Nick Aldridge and Antonio Russell added 12 points apiece. Western Carolina opened the game by taking an 11-point lead midway through the first half. But Chattanooga responded to take a 38-37 lead at halftime. The Mocs extended that lead to as many as 14 points in the second half. Western Carolina struggled from the field, shooting just 34.8 percent for the game. Chattanooga shot 51.9 percent, including 54.5 percent from 3-point range.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
